## EU5 Localization Reference
## Source: https://eu5.paradoxwikis.com/Localization
## Last Updated: December 5, 2025

‚úÖ **COMPREHENSIVE DOCUMENTATION AVAILABLE**
This is the complete localization system reference for Europa Universalis V.

======================
SUPPORTED LANGUAGES
======================

EU5 supports 11 languages:

1. english          (English)
2. braz_por         (Brazilian Portuguese)
3. french           (French)
4. german           (German)
5. polish           (Polish)
6. russian          (Russian)
7. spanish          (Spanish)
8. japanese         (Japanese)
9. simp_chinese     (Simplified Chinese)
10. korean          (Korean)
11. turkish         (Turkish)

======================
FILE FORMAT & STRUCTURE
======================

FILE NAMING CONVENTION
----------------------------------
Filename MUST end with: _l_<language>.yml

‚úÖ CORRECT:
- events_l_english.yml
- traits_l_german.yml
- my_mod_content_l_spanish.yml

‚ùå INCORRECT:
- events_english.yml              # Missing _l_
- events.yml                      # Missing language code
- events_l_english.txt            # Wrong extension (.txt instead of .yml)

FILE ENCODING
----------------------------------
‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Files MUST be saved as UTF-8 with BOM (Byte Order Mark)

In most editors:
- VS Code: "UTF-8 with BOM"
- Notepad++: Encoding > UTF-8-BOM
- Sublime Text: File > Save with Encoding > UTF-8 with BOM

Without BOM, the engine may fail to load the file!

BASIC STRUCTURE
----------------------------------
l_english:                            # Language header (REQUIRED)
 key1: "Localized text"               # Key-value pair
 key2: "More text"
 key3: "Text with [data]"

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT RULES:
1. First line MUST be: l_<language>:
2. Use ONE SPACE (not tab) for indentation
3. Key and value separated by colon and space: key: "value"
4. Values MUST be in double quotes: "text"
5. Keys use snake_case: my_event_title

COMPLETE EXAMPLE
----------------------------------
l_english:
 my_event_title: "A Strange Discovery"
 my_event_desc: "Our scholars have found something unusual in [target_country.GetName]."
 my_event_option_a: "Investigate further"
 my_event_option_b: "Ignore this oddity"
 my_trait_name: "Brilliant Strategist"
 desc_brilliant_strategist: "This character has exceptional military insight."

======================
LOAD ORDER
======================

FILE LOADING SEQUENCE
----------------------------------
Files are loaded in REVERSE ALPHABETICAL ORDER (Z to A).

Example load order:
1. z_my_overrides_l_english.yml       # Loaded FIRST
2. events_l_english.yml
3. countries_l_english.yml
4. 00_base_l_english.yml              # Loaded LAST

OVERRIDING LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
To override existing keys, use the 'replace' folder:

game/in_game/localization/replace/my_overrides_l_english.yml

Keys in 'replace' folder override vanilla keys.

MOD LOAD ORDER
----------------------------------
Mods load after vanilla, so mod localization automatically overrides vanilla 
localization for matching keys.

======================
BASIC SYNTAX
======================

SIMPLE KEY-VALUE
----------------------------------
l_english:
 my_key: "My localized text"

MULTILINE TEXT
----------------------------------
For very long text, use literal block scalar (|):

l_english:
 long_description: |
  This is a very long description
  that spans multiple lines.
  Each line will be preserved.

Or folded scalar (>):

l_english:
 long_description: >
  This is a very long description
  that will be folded into a single
  line with spaces.

COMMENTS
----------------------------------
# This is a comment (ignored by parser)

l_english:
 my_key: "Value"                      # Inline comment

======================
LOCALIZATION REUSE
======================

EMBEDDING OTHER KEYS
----------------------------------
Use $key$ to embed another localization key:

l_english:
 country_france: "France"
 ruler_of_france: "The ruler of $country_france$"
 # Result: "The ruler of France"

NESTED EMBEDDING
----------------------------------
l_english:
 word_great: "Great"
 word_power: "Power"
 great_power: "$word_great$ $word_power$"
 # Result: "Great Power"

======================
COLOR CODES
======================

SIMPLE COLOR CODES
----------------------------------
#R - Red
#G - Green
#E - Blue (historical reasons, "E" for "electricblue")
#V - White (historical reasons, "V" for "ivory/Vanilla")
#! - Reset to default color

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 warning_text: "#R Warning: #! This is dangerous!"
 # Result: "Warning:" in red, "This is dangerous!" in default color

NAMED COLOR CODES
----------------------------------
#color_yellow
#color_gray
#color_dark_gray
#color_light_gray
#color_orange
#color_purple
#color_pink
#color_brown
#color_black
#color_white

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 gold_text: "#color_yellow 1000 Gold#!"
 warning: "#color_red DANGER#!"

HEX COLOR CODES
----------------------------------
Use hexadecimal RGB values:

#RRGGBB

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 custom_color: "#FF5500 Custom orange text#!"
 cyan_text: "#00FFFF Cyan text#!"

======================
TEXT FORMATTING
======================

BOLD
----------------------------------
#bold Text to be bold#!

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 important: "This is #bold very important#!"

ITALIC
----------------------------------
#italic Text to be italic#!

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 emphasis: "This is #italic emphasized#!"

COMBINING FORMATTING
----------------------------------
You can combine color and formatting:

l_english:
 formatted: "#R #bold Red and bold#! #G #italic Green and italic#!"

======================
TEXT ICONS
======================

COMMON ICONS
----------------------------------
EU5 uses @ symbols for inline icons:

@time!                                # Clock icon
@gold!                                # Gold/ducats icon
@warning_icon!                        # Warning/alert icon
@trigger_yes!                         # Green checkmark
@trigger_no!                          # Red X
@adm!                                 # Administrative power icon
@dip!                                 # Diplomatic power icon
@mil!                                 # Military power icon
@manpower!                            # Manpower icon
@prestige!                            # Prestige icon
@legitimacy!                          # Legitimacy icon
@stability!                           # Stability icon
@corruption!                          # Corruption icon
@war_exhaustion!                      # War exhaustion icon
@army!                                # Army icon
@navy!                                # Navy icon
@fort!                                # Fort icon
@trade!                               # Trade icon
@production!                          # Production icon
@tax!                                 # Tax icon
@development!                         # Development icon
@autonomy!                            # Autonomy icon
@unrest!                              # Unrest icon
@culture!                             # Culture icon
@religion!                            # Religion icon
@reform!                              # Reform icon
@idea!                                # Idea icon
@advisor!                             # Advisor icon
@general!                             # General icon
@admiral!                             # Admiral icon

ICON USAGE EXAMPLES
----------------------------------
l_english:
 cost_description: "Costs @gold! 100 ducats and @manpower! 5000 men"
 requirement: "@trigger_yes! Has at least @adm! 5 Administrative skill"
 warning: "@warning_icon! This action is risky!"
 time_remaining: "@time! 12 months remaining"

RESOURCE ICONS
----------------------------------
@laborers!                            # Labor force
@wood!                                # Wood resource
@stone!                               # Stone resource
@iron!                                # Iron resource
@grain!                               # Grain resource
@livestock!                           # Livestock resource
@fish!                                # Fish resource
@salt!                                # Salt resource
@wine!                                # Wine resource
@cloth!                               # Cloth resource

======================
DATA FUNCTIONS
======================

DATA BINDING IN LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
Use square brackets to insert dynamic game data:

[ScopeName.FunctionName]

COMMON SCOPE NAMES
----------------------------------
ROOT                                  # Current scope
THIS                                  # Current scope (alias)
PREV                                  # Previous scope
target_country                        # Saved scope (via save_scope_as)
saved_character                       # Saved scope

GETNAME FUNCTION
----------------------------------
Get the name of a country/character/province:

[Country.GetName]                     # Country name
[Character.GetName]                   # Character name
[Province.GetName]                    # Province name

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 event_desc: "The ruler of [ROOT.GetName] has died."
 # Result: "The ruler of France has died." (if ROOT is France)

GETNAMEWITHFLAG
----------------------------------
Get name with inline flag icon:

[Country.GetNameWithFlag]

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 alliance: "We have allied with [target_country.GetNameWithFlag]."

GETADJECTIVE
----------------------------------
Get the adjective form:

[Country.GetAdjective]                # "French" instead of "France"

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 culture: "The [ROOT.GetAdjective] culture is dominant."
 # Result: "The French culture is dominant."

GETLAW FUNCTION
----------------------------------
Get the value/name of a law:

[Country.GetLaw('law_key')]

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 current_law: "Current succession law: [ROOT.GetLaw('succession_law')]"

SCRIPTVALUE FUNCTION
----------------------------------
Get calculated script values:

[Country.ScriptValue('value_key')]

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 calculated: "Total power: [ROOT.ScriptValue('total_military_power')]"

CHARACTER-SPECIFIC FUNCTIONS
----------------------------------
[Character.GetAbilityTooltipAsRuler]  # Ruler ability tooltip
[Character.GetAge]                    # Character age
[Character.GetDynasty]                # Dynasty name
[Character.GetTitle]                  # Title (Duke, King, etc.)

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 ruler_info: "[ROOT.GetRuler.GetName], age [ROOT.GetRuler.GetAge], of the [ROOT.GetRuler.GetDynasty] dynasty"

GETNAMEWITHNOFORCE (Historical)
----------------------------------
[Country.GetNameWithNoTooltip]        # Name without tooltip

Useful when you don't want the hover tooltip on the country name.

======================
FUNCTION FORMATTING MODIFIERS
======================

These modifiers change how numerical values are displayed:

PLUS/MINUS SIGN (=)
----------------------------------
=                                     # Always show +/- sign

[Country.ScriptValue('value'|=)]

EXAMPLE:
 modifier_display: "Modifier: [value|=]"
 # Result: "Modifier: +5" or "Modifier: -3"

COLORED POSITIVE/NEGATIVE (+)
----------------------------------
+                                     # Green for positive, red for negative

[Country.ScriptValue('value'|+)]

EXAMPLE:
 opinion_change: "Opinion: [opinion|+]"
 # Result: "Opinion: +20" (in green) or "Opinion: -10" (in red)

INVERTED COLOR (-)
----------------------------------
-                                     # Red for positive, green for negative

[Country.ScriptValue('corruption'|-)]

EXAMPLE:
 corruption_display: "Corruption: [corruption|-]"
 # Result: "Corruption: +5" (in red - bad!) or "Corruption: -2" (in green - good!)

UPPERCASE (U)
----------------------------------
U                                     # Convert to uppercase

[Country.GetName|U]

EXAMPLE:
 title: "[ROOT.GetName|U]"
 # Result: "FRANCE" instead of "France"

PERCENTAGE (%)
----------------------------------
%                                     # Convert decimal to percentage

[value|%]                             # 0.25 becomes 25%

EXAMPLE:
 tax_rate: "Tax rate: [tax|%]"
 # Result: "Tax rate: 25%"

DECIMAL PLACES (0-5)
----------------------------------
0 - No decimal places (integer)
1 - One decimal place
2 - Two decimal places
3 - Three decimal places
4 - Four decimal places
5 - Five decimal places

[value|2]                             # 3.14159 becomes 3.14

EXAMPLE:
 precise_value: "Modifier: [modifier|3]"
 # Result: "Modifier: 1.234"

THOUSANDS SEPARATOR (K)
----------------------------------
K                                     # Add thousands separator

[value|K]                             # 1000 becomes 1,000

EXAMPLE:
 population: "Population: [pop|K]"
 # Result: "Population: 1,500,000"

COMBINING MODIFIERS
----------------------------------
You can chain multiple modifiers with pipes:

[value|=2+]                           # Show sign, 2 decimals, colored

EXAMPLE:
 complex: "Value: [modifier|=2+]"
 # Result: "Value: +1.25" (with green color for positive)

======================
CONCEPTS SYSTEM
======================

WHAT ARE CONCEPTS?
----------------------------------
Concepts are predefined tooltips for game mechanics, defined in:
/common/game_concepts/

Use them to provide consistent help tooltips.

SYNTAX
----------------------------------
[concept_name|e]

The |e adds the concept link with tooltip.

EXAMPLES
----------------------------------
l_english:
 help_text: "This affects your [concept_stability|e]."
 # Hovering over "stability" shows the concept tooltip

 tutorial: "Increase your [concept_prestige|e] to gain advantages."

COMMON CONCEPTS
----------------------------------
concept_stability
concept_prestige
concept_legitimacy
concept_administrative_power
concept_diplomatic_power
concept_military_power
concept_development
concept_autonomy
concept_unrest
concept_war_exhaustion
concept_manpower
concept_trade
concept_production
concept_tax

======================
CUSTOM TOOLTIPS
======================

BASIC CUSTOM TOOLTIP
----------------------------------
#TOOLTIP:tooltip_key visible_text#!

When hovering over "visible_text", shows the tooltip defined by "tooltip_key".

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 event_option: "Choose this #TOOLTIP:option_a_tooltip option#!"
 option_a_tooltip: "This option will give you +1 Stability but cost 50 gold."

MULTIPLE TOOLTIPS
----------------------------------
You can have multiple custom tooltips in one string:

l_english:
 complex_text: "You can #TOOLTIP:tip1 do this#! or #TOOLTIP:tip2 do that#!."
 tip1: "This gives +10% tax"
 tip2: "This gives +5% manpower"

======================
SAVED SCOPES IN LOCALIZATION
======================

SCOUNTRY (Saved Country)
----------------------------------
Reference a saved country scope:

SCOPE.sCountry('name')

EXAMPLE:
# In event script:
random_neighbor_country = {
    save_scope_as = rival_nation
}

# In localization:
l_english:
 event_desc: "Our rival [ROOT.sCountry('rival_nation').GetName] is weak!"

SCHARACTER (Saved Character)
----------------------------------
Reference a saved character scope:

SCOPE.sCharacter('name')

EXAMPLE:
# In event script:
random_courtier = {
    save_scope_as = traitor
}

# In localization:
l_english:
 event_desc: "The traitor [ROOT.sCharacter('traitor').GetName] has been found!"

======================
CUSTOMIZABLE LOCALIZATION
======================

WHAT IS CUSTOMIZABLE LOCALIZATION?
----------------------------------
Dynamic text generation based on conditions, defined in:
/common/customizable_localization/

USAGE SYNTAX
----------------------------------
Custom('customizable_name')

DEFINING CUSTOMIZABLE LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
File: /common/customizable_localization/my_custom_loc.txt

customizable_name = {
    type = character                  # country, character, etc.
    
    random_valid = {                  # Pick randomly from valid options
        trigger = {
            age >= 50
        }
        localization_key = "old_description"
    }
    
    text = {
        trigger = {
            age < 30
        }
        localization_key = "young_description"
    }
    
    text = {
        trigger = {
            always = yes              # Fallback
        }
        localization_key = "default_description"
    }
}

USING IN LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
l_english:
 event_desc: "The character is [Character.Custom('customizable_name')]."
 young_description: "young and vigorous"
 old_description: "wise with age"
 default_description: "in their prime"

RANDOM_VALID
----------------------------------
If multiple triggers are valid, 'random_valid' picks one randomly.
'text' blocks use first valid match.

======================
PRONOUN HANDLING
======================

GENDERED PRONOUNS
----------------------------------
Some functions automatically handle gendered pronouns:

[Character.GetSheHe]                  # "she" or "he"
[Character.GetHerHis]                 # "her" or "his"
[Character.GetHerHim]                 # "her" or "him"
[Character.GetHerselfHimself]         # "herself" or "himself"

EXAMPLE:
l_english:
 event_desc: "[ROOT.GetRuler.GetName] has proven [Character.GetHerselfHimself] worthy."
 # Result: "Elizabeth has proven herself worthy." or "Charles has proven himself worthy."

CAPITALIZED PRONOUNS
----------------------------------
[Character.GetSheHeCap]               # "She" or "He" (capitalized)
[Character.GetHerHisCap]              # "Her" or "His"

======================
BEST PRACTICES
======================

1. FILE ORGANIZATION
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Group related keys in same file
‚úÖ Use descriptive filenames
‚úÖ Keep trait descriptions in traits/ subfolder
‚úÖ Keep event text in events/ subfolder

EXAMPLE STRUCTURE:
localization/
  english/
    events/
      my_events_l_english.yml
    traits/
      my_traits_l_english.yml
    modifiers/
      my_modifiers_l_english.yml

2. KEY NAMING CONVENTIONS
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Use clear, descriptive names
‚úÖ Include context in key name
‚úÖ Use consistent prefixes

EXAMPLES:
event_mymod_1_title                   # Event title
event_mymod_1_desc                    # Event description
event_mymod_1_option_a                # Event option A
trait_brilliant_general               # Trait name
desc_brilliant_general                # Trait description (NOT brilliant_general_desc!)
modifier_plague_effect                # Modifier name

3. TRAIT DESCRIPTIONS
----------------------------------
‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Use desc_<trait> pattern for trait descriptions!

‚úÖ CORRECT:
trait_incompetent_fool: "Incompetent Fool"
desc_incompetent_fool: "This character lacks basic competence."

‚ùå WRONG (legacy pattern, don't use):
incompetent_fool_desc: "..."

4. SCOPES IN LOCALIZATION
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Use save_scope_as for references
‚úÖ Document expected scopes in comments
‚úÖ Test with different scope contexts

EXAMPLE:
# Expects: ROOT = country, saved scope 'target_country' must exist
l_english:
 event_desc: "We have discovered [target_country.GetName]."

5. DYNAMIC TEXT
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Use data functions for dynamic values
‚úÖ Provide context for scope references
‚úÖ Handle edge cases (dead characters, destroyed countries)

6. COLOR & FORMATTING
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Use colors sparingly for emphasis
‚úÖ Always close formatting with #!
‚úÖ Test readability with all colors
‚ùå Don't overuse bold/italic

7. ICONS
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Use icons for resources/stats
‚úÖ Be consistent with icon usage
‚úÖ Test icon display in UI

8. TESTING
----------------------------------
‚úÖ Test all languages (text length varies!)
‚úÖ Verify UTF-8 BOM encoding
‚úÖ Check for missing keys (logs)
‚úÖ Verify special characters display correctly
‚úÖ Test tooltip functionality

======================
COMMON ERRORS & FIXES
======================

‚ùå ERROR: Keys not loading
Cause: File not UTF-8 with BOM

‚úÖ FIX: Save file as UTF-8 with BOM
In VS Code: Bottom-right corner > "UTF-8 with BOM"

‚ùå ERROR: Missing language header
l_english                             # Missing colon!
 my_key: "value"

‚úÖ FIX: Add colon
l_english:
 my_key: "value"

‚ùå ERROR: Wrong indentation
l_english:
my_key: "value"                       # No indent!

‚úÖ FIX: Add one space indent
l_english:
 my_key: "value"

‚ùå ERROR: Missing quotes
l_english:
 my_key: value                        # No quotes!

‚úÖ FIX: Add quotes
l_english:
 my_key: "value"

‚ùå ERROR: Trait description not showing
l_english:
 my_trait: "Trait Name"
 my_trait_desc: "Description"         # WRONG pattern!

‚úÖ FIX: Use desc_ prefix
l_english:
 my_trait: "Trait Name"
 desc_my_trait: "Description"

‚ùå ERROR: Color not resetting
l_english:
 my_text: "#R Red text that continues too long"

‚úÖ FIX: Close with #!
l_english:
 my_text: "#R Red text#! normal text"

‚ùå ERROR: Scope doesn't exist
l_english:
 event_desc: "We found [target_country.GetName]."
 # ERROR if target_country wasn't saved in script!

‚úÖ FIX: Ensure scope is saved
# In event script:
random_neighbor_country = {
    save_scope_as = target_country
}

‚ùå ERROR: Icon not displaying
l_english:
 my_text: "@wrong_icon! Text"         # Icon doesn't exist

‚úÖ FIX: Use valid icon name
l_english:
 my_text: "@gold! Text"

======================
DEBUGGING LOCALIZATION
======================

ENABLE DEBUG MODE
----------------------------------
Add to launch options: -debug_mode

VIEW LOCALIZATION KEYS
----------------------------------
Console command: debug_localization

Shows keys instead of localized text.

CHECK LOGS
----------------------------------
Location: Documents\Paradox Interactive\Europa Universalis V\logs\

Look for:
- Missing localization key warnings
- File parsing errors
- Encoding issues

COMMON LOG MESSAGES
----------------------------------
"Missing localization for key: my_key"
‚Üí Key not defined in any localization file

"Failed to parse localization file: my_file_l_english.yml"
‚Üí Syntax error or wrong encoding

"Localization key 'my_key' defined multiple times"
‚Üí Duplicate key definition (last one wins)

======================
PRACTICAL EXAMPLES
======================

EXAMPLE 1: Complete Event Localization
----------------------------------
l_english:
 # Event: Strange Discovery
 event_mymod_discovery_1_title: "A Strange Discovery"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_desc: "Our scholars have uncovered something unusual in [target_country.GetName]. The artifact appears to be of [target_country.GetAdjective] origin, dating back centuries. What shall we do?"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_option_a: "Study it carefully"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_option_a_tooltip: "Gain @adm! 50 Administrative Power"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_option_b: "Display it publicly"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_option_b_tooltip: "Gain @prestige! 10 Prestige"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_option_c: "Return it to [target_country.GetName]"
 event_mymod_discovery_1_option_c_tooltip: "Improve relations with [target_country.GetName]"

EXAMPLE 2: Trait with Description
----------------------------------
l_english:
 # Trait: Brilliant Strategist
 brilliant_strategist: "Brilliant Strategist"
 desc_brilliant_strategist: "This character has an exceptional gift for #bold military strategy#!. They can see patterns in battle that others miss and turn defeats into victories.\n\nEffects:\n@mil! +2 Military Skill\n@army! +10% Army Morale"

EXAMPLE 3: Complex Modifier Display
----------------------------------
l_english:
 modifier_economic_boom: "Economic Boom"
 desc_modifier_economic_boom: "Our economy is thriving!\n\n#G Bonuses:#!\n@tax! Tax Income: [modifier|=2+%]\n@production! Production Efficiency: [modifier|=2+%]\n@trade! Trade Power: [modifier|=2+%]\n\nDuration: @time! [duration] months"

EXAMPLE 4: Conditional Text with Custom Loc
----------------------------------
# Script: /common/customizable_localization/character_age.txt
character_age_description = {
    type = character
    
    text = {
        trigger = { age < 20 }
        localization_key = "age_young"
    }
    
    text = {
        trigger = { age >= 20 age < 40 }
        localization_key = "age_adult"
    }
    
    text = {
        trigger = { age >= 40 age < 60 }
        localization_key = "age_middle"
    }
    
    text = {
        trigger = { age >= 60 }
        localization_key = "age_old"
    }
}

# Localization:
l_english:
 character_description: "[Character.GetName] is [Character.Custom('character_age_description')]."
 age_young: "#G young and energetic#!"
 age_adult: "in their prime"
 age_middle: "experienced and wise"
 age_old: "#color_gray aged and venerable#!"

EXAMPLE 5: Warning with Icons and Colors
----------------------------------
l_english:
 rebellion_warning: "@warning_icon! #R REBELLION IMMINENT#!\n\nUnrest in [Province.GetName]: [unrest|=1]\nChance of revolt: [chance|=0%]\n\n#bold Recommended Actions:#!\n‚Ä¢ Lower autonomy penalty\n‚Ä¢ Station troops in province\n‚Ä¢ Address rebel demands"

EXAMPLE 6: Resource Display
----------------------------------
l_english:
 treasury_report: "Treasury Report\n\n@gold! Gold: [Country.GetGold|K]\n@manpower! Manpower: [Country.GetManpower|K]\n@adm! Admin Power: [Country.GetAdmPower|0]\n@dip! Diplo Power: [Country.GetDipPower|0]\n@mil! Military Power: [Country.GetMilPower|0]"

EXAMPLE 7: Relationship Display
----------------------------------
l_english:
 relation_status: "Relations with [target_country.GetNameWithFlag]\n\nOpinion: [opinion|=+]\nTrust: [trust|=+]\nFavor: [favor|=+]\n\n[concept_opinion|e] determines diplomatic possibilities."

======================
LOCALIZATION WORKFLOW
======================

STEP-BY-STEP GUIDE
----------------------------------
1. Create localization file
   - Name: <description>_l_english.yml
   - Save as UTF-8 with BOM
   - Add language header: l_english:

2. Define keys
   - Use descriptive snake_case names
   - Indent with one space
   - Wrap values in double quotes

3. Add dynamic content
   - Use [Scope.Function] for data
   - Use @icon! for icons
   - Use #color for colors

4. Test in-game
   - Launch game
   - Check if keys display correctly
   - Check logs for errors

5. Refine
   - Adjust text length for UI
   - Test with different scopes
   - Verify tooltips work

6. Document
   - Comment complex keys
   - Note expected scopes
   - Keep consistent style

======================
CROSS-REFERENCES
======================
üìÑ Related Files:
- EU5_SCOPES_REFERENCE.txt - Understanding scope context
- EU5_SCOPE_LINKS_REFERENCE.txt - Navigating between scopes
- EU5_GUI_SCRIPT_REFERENCE.txt - Displaying localization in GUI
- /common/game_concepts/ - Concept definitions
- /common/customizable_localization/ - Dynamic text generation
- game/in_game/localization/ - Vanilla localization files
